interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Arrival [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2010/04/17 Store: Ron Silver (Actor), Charlie Sheen (Actor), David N. Twohy (Director), David Twohy (Director) & 1 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Mystery & Thrillers Product Description: ['Zane Ziminski is an astrophysicist who receives a message that seems to have extraterrestrial origins. Eerily soon after his discovery, Zane is fired. He then embarks on a search to determine the origins of the transmission that leads him into a Hitchcockian labyrinth of paranoia and intrigue.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Mystery', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, WidescreenMultiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen See more', 'Contributor': 'David N. Twohy, Catalina Botello, Phyllis Applegate, Roger Cudney, Tony Johnson, David Twohy, Ron Silver, Ángel de la Peña, Thomas Smith, Richard Schiff, Alan Coates, Leon Rippy, Javier Morga, Jorge Becerril, Luisa Huertas, Dave Galasso, James Steele, Alejandro Usigli, Shane, Jorge Zepeda, Andrea Sisniega, Monica Dionne, Maria Coronel, David Villalpando, Charlie Sheen, Jacqueline Voltaire, Ellen Bradley, José Garcia, Buddy Joe Hooker, Georg Lillitsch, Teri Polo, Ree Johnson, Lindsay CrouseDavid N. Twohy, Catalina Botello, Phyllis Applegate, Roger Cudney, Tony Johnson, David Twohy, Ron Silver, Ángel de la Peña, Thomas Smith, Richard Schiff, Alan Coates, Leon Rippy, Javier Morga, Jorge Becerril, Luisa Huertas, Dave Galasso, James Steele, Alejandro Usigli, S… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': 'LGT25338BR', 'Director': 'David N. Twohy, David Twohy', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 21, 2009', 'Actors': 'Ron Silver, Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Crouse, Richard Schiff, Shane', 'Producers': 'James Steele, Thomas Smith', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I saw this by accident on FiOS. What a stinker. Plot is awful. Characters thin. Effects cheesy. "Sets" phony. The very idea of buying this on Blu-ray is laughable. Sheen is a joke. He should stick to what he knows: one-line sex jokes, hookers and beating up his wives.

This is a third world-produced "film" that should have gone straight to video that I'd perhaps buy used for $1 at a garage sale, and then throw away to save space. This makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look plausible.

Man am I glad I saw it on a backwater channel and didn't put any money out on this turkey, even as a rental. There is no doubt why it failed at the box office. It would have failed at 2:00 AM on Syfy channel.

If this is what passes for good sci-fi, y'all have a pretty low threshold for quality. Review Title: Stinker Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

What a stinker. Plot is awful. Characters thin. Effects cheesy. "Sets" phony. The very idea of buying this on Blu-ray is laughable. Sheen is a joke. This is a third world-produced "film" that should have gone straight to video that I'd perhaps buy used for $1 at a garage sale, and then throw away to save space. This makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look plausible.

If this is what passes for good sci-fi, y'all have a pretty low threshold for quality. Stinker
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** The user shows a clear preference for movies, particularly in the Mystery and Thriller genres. However, they have a critical stance towards films, especially those with low production quality or poor storytelling.

- **Critical Viewpoint:** The user is highly discerning, often expressing dissatisfaction with movie plots, character development, and visual effects. They appear to have a strong aversion to films they perceive as subpar or lacking originality.

- **Entertainment Consumption:** The user prefers to watch films through alternative platforms rather than committing to purchases unless significant value is perceived. They are cautious about financial investment in media, indicating they would consider buying only if the price is very low, such as at a garage sale.

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user tends to rate films quite harshly when unsatisfied, as evidenced by the extremely low rating given.

- **General Attitude:** There is a sarcastic tone present in the user’s feedback, suggesting a person who values quality in film and does not hesitate to voice strong opinions when expectations are not met.

Overall, this user values high-quality cinematic experiences and is unlikely to embrace or purchase content that does not meet their critical standards.
